Description: Rim sherd of East Greek Wild Goat Style pottery dinos; white slip; interior: reserved with black band at rim; on top of flat rim, double guilloche pattern between bands; exterior: top of wall glazed, above dot and billet band; below, tongue pattern and part of shoulder frieze with part of pendant roundel and triangle as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum GR 1886,0401.1122. Lemos places this sherd in the Würzburg Chalice Group. The sherds from this group display stylistic similarities with the two Würzburg chalices, see Lemos 1991, pl. 20-1, no. 236-7. However, according to Williams the piece is not Chian, even if the clay is typically Chian.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 72, p. 247, no. 295)
Williams 2006a / The Chian Pottery from Naukratis (p. 132 note 10) (Regarding 1886,0401.1122)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.247)
